abstract.text: We report our measurement on longitudinal spin transfer, DLL, from high energy polarized protons to Λ andΛ hyperons in proton-proton collisions at √ s = 200 GeV with the STAR detector at RHIC.
The current measurements cover Λ,Λ pseudorapidity |η| < 1.2 and transverse momenta pT up to 4 GeV/c using the data taken in 2005.
The longitudinal spin transfer is found to be DLL = −0.03 ± 0.13(stat) ± 0.04(syst) for inclusive Λ and DLL = −0.12 ± 0.08(stat) ± 0.03(syst) for inclusiveΛ hyperons with η = 0.5 and pT = 3.7 GeV/c.
The prospects with 2009 data and the future measurements are also given.

body_text.text: 1. Introduction Λ hyperons have been studied extensively in different aspects of spin physics, due to their selfanalyzing weak decay.
The longitudinal polarization of Λ hyperons has been measured in e + e − annihilation and lepton-nucleon deep inelastic scattering (DIS) with polarized beams and/or targets [1].
These studies can provide access to polarized fragmentation functions and the spin content of the Λ.
Here we report our measurement on longitudinal spin transfer (D LL ) from the proton beam to Λ(Λ) produced in proton-proton collisions at √ s=200 GeV [2],
where the superscript + or − denotes the helicity.
Within the factorization framework, the production cross sections are described in terms of calculable partonic cross sections and nonperturbative parton distribution and fragmentation functions.
The production cross section has been measured for transverse momenta, p T , up to about 5 GeV/c and is well described by perturbative QCD evaluations [3].

The spin transfer D LL is thus expected to be sensitive to polarized fragmentation function and helicity distribution function of nucleon, as reflected in different model predictions of D LL at RHIC [4,5,6,7].
The spin transfer D LL in Eq.
(1) is equal to the polarization of Λ (Λ) hyperons P Λ(Λ) , if the proton beam is fully polarized.
P Λ(Λ) can be measured via the weak decay channel Λ → pπ − (Λ →pπ + ) from the angular distribution of the final state,
where σ is the Λ (Λ) production cross section and L is the integrated luminosity.
A is the detector acceptance, which is in general a function of cos θ * as well as other observables.
α Λ =−αΛ = 0.642 ± 0.013 [8] is the weak decay parameter, and θ * is the angle between the Λ(Λ) polarization direction and the (anti-)proton momentum in the Λ (Λ) rest frame.
Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR
In 2005, the Solenoidal Tracker at RHIC (STAR) [9] collected an integrated luminosity of 2 pb −1 pp data, with average longitudinal beam polarizations of 52± 3% and 48± 3% for the two beams.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The proton polarization was measured for each beam and each beam fill using Coulomb-Nuclear Interference (CNI) proton-carbon polarimeters [10].
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: Different beam spin configurations were used for successive beam bunches and the pattern was changed between beam fills.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The data were sorted by beam spin configuration.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The analyzed data sample includes three different triggers.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: One is the minimum bias (MB) trigger sample, defined by a coincidence signal from Beam-Beam Counters (BBC) on both sides of STAR interaction region.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The other data samples were recorded with the MB trigger condition and with two additional trigger conditions: a high-tower (HT) and a jet-patch (JP).
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The HT trigger condition required the proton collision signal in BBC coincidence with a transverse energy deposit E T > 2.6 GeV in at least one Barrel Electromagnetic Calorimeter (BEMC) tower, covering ∆η × ∆φ = 0.05 × 0.05 in pseudorapidity η and azimuthal angle φ.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The JP trigger condition imposed the MB condition in coincidence with an energy deposit E T > 6.5 GeV in at least one of six BEMC patches each covering ∆η × ∆φ = 1 × 1.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The total BEMC coverage was 0 < η < 1 with full azimuth in 2005 and became −1 < η < 1 after 2006.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The Λ (Λ) candidates were identified from the topology of the weak decay channel to pπ − (pπ + ), which has a branching ratio of 63.9% [8].
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: Charged particle tracks in the 0.5 T magnetic field were measured with the Time Projection Chamber (TPC), covering 0 < φ < 2π and |η| < 1.3.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The charge tracks after particle identification from specific energy loss dE/dx in TPC were paired to form a Λ(Λ) candidate and topological selections were applied to reduce background [2,3].
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The selections included criteria for the distance of closest approach between the paired tracks and the distance between the point of closest approach and the beam collision vertex, and demanded that the momentum sum of the track pair pointed at the collision vertex.
body_text.section: Λ(Λ) reconstruction at STAR

body_text.text: The criteria were tuned to preserve the signal while reducing the background fraction to 10% or less.

body_text.text: In addition to longitudinal spin transfer, the transverse spin transfer of hyperons from the proton is also of particular interest in pp collisions, as it can provide access to the transverse spin content of the nucleon, i.e., the transversity distribution, which is chiral odd and still poorly known in experiment [14].
body_text.section: Extraction of D LL and the recent results

body_text.text: The transverse spin transfer D N N with respect to the production plane has been measured by the E704 experiment, and sizable spin transfer was observed at large x F (≡ 2p z / √ s) region [15].
body_text.section: Extraction of D LL and the recent results

body_text.text: We have started looking at the transverse spin transfer of Λ (Λ) at mid-pseudorapidities with TPC at STAR.
body_text.section: Extraction of D LL and the recent results

body_text.text: A Forward Hadron Calorimeter (FHC) may be installed behind the available Forward Meson Spectrometer (FMS) in the future at STAR, which may enable the reconstruction of Λ hyperons at large x F region via the decay channel to nπ 0 with π 0 detected by the FMS and n by the FHC.
body_text.section: Extraction of D LL and the recent results

body_text.text: The transverse spin transfer measurements in the forward region are expected to be sizable and can provide valuable information for the transversity distribution of nucleon.
body_text.section: Extraction of D LL and the recent results

body_text.text: In addition, the longitudinal spin transfer D LL of Λ (Λ) in the forward region can provide additional sensitivity to the strange quark polarization [16].

body_text.text: Summary

In summary, we reported our measurements on the longitudinal spin transfer to Λ andΛ hyperons in √ s = 200 GeV polarized proton-proton collisions for hyperon p T up to 4 GeV/c with STAR data taken in 2005.
body_text.section: Summary

body_text.text: The spin transfer is found to be D LL = −0.03±0.13(stat)±0.04(syst) for Λ and D LL = −0.12 ± 0.08(stat) ± 0.03(syst) forΛ hyperons with η = 0.5 and p T = 3.7 GeV/c.
body_text.section: Summary

body_text.text: The longitudinal spin transfer is sensitive to the polarized parton distribution and polarized fragmentation functions.
body_text.section: Summary

body_text.text: The present results for Λ andΛ have uncertainties that are comparable to the variation between model expectations for the longitudinal spin transfer at RHIC.
body_text.section: Summary

body_text.text: With the 2009 data, the p T coverage and the precision of D LL measurement is expected to be improved significantly.
body_text.section: Summary

body_text.text: The possibility of measuring both longitudinal and transverse spin transfer for Λ (Λ) hyperons in the forward region at STAR is also discussed.
body_text.section: Summary
